info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 12:56AM EST until January 10 at 3:53PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Excessive rainfall causing slow onset flooding of several streams, resulting isolated to scattered areas of lowland flooding. * WHERE...portions of Rutherford County, North Carolina * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood-prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 AM EST, High flows and out-of-bank conditions continue along larger streams in Rutherford County from earlier heavy rainfall, especially along the Second Broad and Broad Rivers, resulting in isolated to scattered nuisance flooding of adjacent low-lying areas from Spindale to Bostic to Caroleen to Cliffside and Harris. Therefore a Flood Advisory will continue for the lower reaches of the Second Broad and Broad Rivers until stream levels fall below bankfull and the flood threat subsides. - The following streamgauge is above Action/Advisory Stage, resulting in nuisance flooding along Second Broad River... ID: LOGN7 NAME: near Logan CURRENT STAGE: 17.04 feet ACTION/ADVISORY STAGE: 15.0 feet MINOR FLOOD STAGE: 22.0 feet CREST: 17.69 feet on January 9th at 09:45 PM TREND: Falling slowly ESTIMATED FORECAST: The Second Broad River may slow in its recession or produce a second, smaller crest overnight tonight or early Wednesday morning before resuming a recession, falling below Action/Advisory Stage later Wednesday. - Some locations that may experience nuisance flooding include... Forest City, Spindale, Ellenboro, Bostic, Alexander Mills, Harris, Caroleen, Henrietta and Cliffside. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
